alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 12:51PM MST until July 14 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE PIPELINE BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 1249 PM MST, Emergency management reported that water is flowing within the confines of containment channels along the Schultz Creek toward U.S. Highway 180. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Schultz Creek and Upper Rio de Flag drainages. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Pipeline Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Areas northwest of Flagstaff. This includes the following highways... Highway 180 between mile markers 218 and 221. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Schultz Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Pipeline Burn Scar. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving. Avoid recently burned areas and downstream locations. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes will occur. Rockslides and mudslides will likely occur in steep terrain.
